standardlastprofile 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Data of load profiles for electricity

Source: R/data.R
load_profiles.Rd

A load profile shows the variation in the electrical load versus time. Data is provided by the German Association of Energy andvWater Industries (BDEW Bundesverband der Energie- und Wasserwirtschaft e.V.). A load profile shows the variation in the electrical load versus time. For each profile there are 96 values for three different days of the week ('working_day', 'saturday', 'sunday'), three different periods of the year ('summer', 'winter', 'transition'), i.e. a total of 3x3x96 observations per profile. See 'Details' for more information.

Usage

load_profiles

Format

load_profiles

A data frame with 9,504 rows and 5 columns:

profile

one of 11 load profiles, see 'Details'

period

one of 'summer', 'winter', 'transition'

weekyday

one of 'saturday', 'sunday', and 'working_day'

timestamp

timestemp in 15-minutes interval

value

electricity load in Watt.

Source

https://www.bdew.de/energie/standardlastprofile-strom/

https://www.bdew.de/media/documents/1999_Repraesentative-VDEW-Lastprofile.pdf

Details

Included are eleven representative load profiles covering three different customer groups:

  • households: 'H0'

  • commercial: 'G0', 'G1', 'G2', 'G3', 'G4', 'G5', 'G6'

  • agriculture: 'L0', 'L1', 'L2'

Call get_load_profile_info() to get description for each profile.

Periods as defined by the BDEW:

  • summer: May 15 to September 14

  • winter: November 1 to March 20

  • transition: March 21 to May 14, and September 15 to October 31

In addition, a distinction is made between three different type of days:

  • 'working_day': Monday to Friday

  • 'saturday': Saturdays; Dec 24th and Dec 31th are considered a 'saturday' too, if they are not a 'sunday'

  • 'sunday': Sundays and all public holidays
